projectPurpose: To provide the source code for an experimental/satirical ad-supported DNS resolver, now deprecated.
mainFeatures: Adds 'sponsorships' to DNS responses (via NXDOMAIN hijacking)
Source code available for self-hosting (due to deprecation)

alternatives.name: BIND
mainFeatures: Supports a wide range of DNS features

alternatives.name: Unbound
mainFeatures: Validating, recursive, and caching DNS resolver

alternatives.name: Redis
alternatives.license: Source Available (RSALv2, SSPLv1) and Open Source (AGPLv3 for Redis 8+)
mainFeatures: Used as database, cache, and message broker
Supports various data structures (strings, lists, sets, hashes, etc.)

alternatives.name: Memcached
mainFeatures: Used to speed up dynamic web applications

alternatives.name: Varnish Cache
mainFeatures: High performance for static and dynamic content

marketPositioning: Adcache was positioned, albeit satirically, as an ad-supported DNS resolver, a concept contrary to prevalent ad-blocking DNS solutions. Its current position is that of a deprecated experimental project, providing source code for those interested in its unique, and likely legally questionable, ad-injection mechanism rather than serving as a production-ready or privacy-focused DNS service. It does not compete in the mainstream DNS or caching markets.
